author: m.kalinin
content: Will inclusion list be disseminated separately to a block? Otherwise, i don't see a reason to send it to EL to validate as a part of gossiping

author: m.kalinin
content: What is the complexity of supporting secp256k1 on CL side? At the first glance it should be moderate, especially when comparing it to the complexity of implementing EL to CL communication flow which implies spam protection and other things as in 7002

author: potuz
content: Yeah, Vitalik is right that any system that puts the IL on the block makes for a free DA riding. It's also surprisingly simple to implement and specify from a CL perspective. Adrian's fear does not apply directly because these come signed by the proposer so we can check signature before sending it to the EL for validation. Also validation on the EL does not necessarily need to be part of gossip validation (and it's not on the current design I think)

author: potuz
content: I'm not sure about seck256kp1 implementation on the CL. If it's simply importing a crypto library and calling a signature verification then it should be simple, but I'm ignorant on the nuances of hashing the pubkey and truncating to 20 bytes.

author: m.kalinin
content: Some time ago I was thinking about paying a data gas for IL's transactions as a solution to free DA issue. But didn't go further with these thoughts than a brief discussion (with Lion and Ansgar)

author: potuz
content: I like Vitalik's design, it requires a little more complexity on the EL to validate if the Payload fulfills it, but Marius tells me it is not that bad

author: m.kalinin
content: For the exits purpose we'd need secp256k1 + keccak256 + EL address computation algo + VoluntaryExit extension or a new message with a new mempool. Which actually might be complicated. It seems like CL devs are opposed to supporting EL's crypto primitives be default, so we'd need an argumentation to persuade them. One of the arguments might be 7002 vs EL's crypto complexity

author: m.kalinin
content: I second that, the design looks good to me! It gives necessary flexibility vs other potential solutions

author: potuz
content: I think in general we are opposed to doing anything if EL devs can do it for us üòù, but in this case it seems to me that the object itself and it's validation logic (except the signature)  resides in the CL. The whole processing is also already implemented on the CL, so if there is any feasible way to verify the signatures either by a call to the EL or by natively verifying it, it may be worth thinking about it.

author: m.kalinin
content: I am thinking about BLS sig on the exit message for pure gossip validation and then deferring EL's sig validation to EL via Engine API as a potential workaround. Ugly but less complicated.

author: potuz
content: I thought about this but this is strictly worse from the UX side. One of the main purposes of the EIP is to enable trustless pools and having the EL address trigger it alone is definitely different than tying it to some BLS address like the validating key for example

author: m.kalinin
content: yes, agree. that's not gonna work at all

author: potuz
content: Nishant is telling me that at least in our side it would be trivial to implement the signature validation
